author: Lauren Strapagiel
title: Fox News Deleted A Tweet About The Quebec Shooting After Canada's Government Objected
text:
Although the only suspect in the shooting is Alexandre Bissonnette — a white French Canadian — there were early reports of two men having been arrested. The other man, who is Moroccan, turned out to be a bystander and police later identified him as a witness.
ID: 10438641 3. And while other media organizations updated their reports and deleted tweets, Fox News tweeted this. View this image ›
Twitter ID: 10438475 The incorrect information was picked up by alt-right websites, feeding hoaxes and conspiracies that the attack was perpetrated by a Muslim.
More than a day after the man was cleared as a suspect, Fox’s tweet remained online.
ID: 10438643 5. On Tuesday, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s director of communications, Kate Purchase, sent Fox News an email asking them to remove the tweet. View this image ›
Twitter ID: 10438485 6. “These tweets by Fox News dishonor the memory of the six victims and their families,” she said. View this image ›
Twitter ID: 10438486 7. “Fear does not make us safer. It makes us weaker.” View this image ›
Twitter ID: 10438487 8. Just over two hours later, the tweet was gone, and Purchase thanked Fox for removing it. View this image ›
Twitter: @katepurchase ID: 10438430 9. Fox News’ managing editor also expressed regret for the tweet. "The earlier tweets have now been deleted. We regret the error.” Refet Kaplan Managing Director, https://t.co/DUK9oZiNfG
— Rob Gillies (@rgilliescanada) ID: 10438653 Bissonnette, meanwhile, faces six counts of murder and five counts of attempted murder and is scheduled to appear in court on Feb. 21.
